topic.title: Performing Searches
topic.shortdesc: Full Text Searches can be prepared for, and then performed in a number of ways.

section.title: Preparing for Full Text Searches
section.p: Before attempting a Full Text Search, you must:

ul.li: Ensure that the current Couchbase Server node has the Search service enabled. This must be performed as part of the node's initial configuration. See Initializing the Cluster for information.
Create an appropriate index. This can be accomplished by means of the UI provided by the Couchbase Web Console. For examples of index-creation, see Searching from the UI and Creating Indexes.

section.p: You may also wish to define and use an analyzer. However, this is only relevant to certain types of query, and is always optional: if you do not specify an analyzer, a default analyzer is provided, if appropriate. Analyzers can be specified by means of the Couchbase Web Console, during index-creation. For more information, see Creating Indexes.

section.title: Performing Full Text Searches
section.p: Full Text Searches can be performed with:

ul.li: The Couchbase Web Console. This UI can also be used to specify indexes and analyzers. See Searching from the UI, for information.
The Couchbase REST API. See Searching with the REST API, for information. See also the page containing REST reference information, Full Text Search API.

The Couchbase SDK. This support seven languages, and allows Full Text Searches to be performed with each. See the SDK's Full Text Search page, for information. Note also that the Searching from the SDK page for the Java SDK provides an extensive code-example that demonstrates multiple options for performing Full Text Searches.

section.title: Establishing Demonstration Indexes
section.p: An extensive code example, using the Java SDK, is provided in Searching with the SDK. This example — which contains fourteeen demonstration calls, each featuring a different query-combination — makes use of three different index-definitions, related to the travel-sample bucket: for the code example to be run successfully, the three indexes must be appropriately established. The definitions are provided in Demonstration Indexes. Instructions on how to use the Couchbase REST API to establish the definitions is provided in the section Index-Creation with the REST API, on the page Creating Indexes.
